final_answer:
This image is funny or satirical because it plays on the literal interpretation of "invisible tape." 

In the first panel, the box is closed, implying the existence of invisible tape inside. The caption "YES," suggests agreement or confirmation. In the second panel, upon opening the box, the tape inside is clearly visible and rolled up, contradicting the label. The caption "BUT" humorously highlights this contradiction, as “invisible” implies it cannot be seen, yet the tape is clearly visible. 

This play on words and expectation vs. reality creates a humorous twist.
